meanings.definition: To increase in volume or intensity.
meanings.sent1: When the music started to turnup, everyone began dancing.
meanings.sent2: I always turnup the heat when it gets cold outside.
meanings.sent3: The excitement in the room really started to turnup when the surprise guest arrived.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project turnedup as she learned more about it.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the air turnedup as the deadline approached.

meanings.sent1: We had a great time at the turnup last night.
meanings.sent2: Are you going to the turnup at Sarah's house this weekend?
meanings.sent3: The turnup was so fun that we lost track of time.
meanings.sent4: The turnup was a blast, with music and laughter filling the room.
meanings.sent5: I can't wait for the turnup next week; it's going to be epic!

meanings.definition: The edible root of a plant, such as a turnip.
meanings.sent1: The chef used fresh turnup in the stew for added flavor.
meanings.sent2: Have you ever tried roasted turnup? It's delicious!
meanings.sent3: The turnup in the salad added a crunchy texture.
meanings.sent4: The farmer harvested a basket full of turnup from the field.
meanings.sent5: The turnup from the garden was the perfect ingredient for the soup.
